intro: Filago montana var. arvensis, commonly known as the field filago, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It has feathery leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. Filago montana var. arvensis is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
